issues.description: The UML in the problem statement defines a method named emptyStock() in class Stock, but the template repository provides this functionality as clearInventory(), and the solution implementation uses emptyStock(). This name mismatch between the UML, template, and solution may confuse students when they try to follow the diagram and starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename clearInventory() in the template to emptyStock() to align with the UML diagram and solution, or update the UML to reflect clearInventory() consistently.

issues.description: The Stock class method for emptying the stock is named clearInventory in the template, whereas the problem statement UML and the solution implementation use emptyStock(), causing students to face an unexpected method name for the same functionality.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the clearInventory method in the template Stock class to emptyStock() so that it matches the problem statement and solution naming.
